statement.tex: \\ \text{Which of the following correctly}\\ \text{defines the required condition? }
\\ \text{Is the following analysis complete and correct?}

reason.tex: \text{Remember, the slope equals the y-coordinate}\\ \text{of the point. And therefore, }\frac{dy}{dx} = y = x^3.

options.tex: \begin{align} \dfrac{dy}{dx} &= 3x^2 = x^3 \implies x^3-3x^2 = 0\\ \implies x^2\cdot(x-3) &= 0 \implies x = 0,3 \end{align} \\ \text{Hence, the required points are }\\ \left(0,0\right)\text{ and }\left(3,27\right).
\begin{align} \dfrac{dy}{dx} &= 3x^2 = x^3 \implies x^3-3x^2 = 0\\ \implies x &= 3 \end{align} \\ \text{Hence, the required point is }\left(3,27\right).
